title: Glen Echo Park: Places
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Places               Places       Did you know that Glen Echo Park is a historic district that is listed on the National Register of Historic Places?   The National Register is America's official list of cultural resources worthy of preservation.    Nominated and added to the register in 1984, there are nine contributing elements to the historic district of Glen Echo Park. Use the links below to learn more about these places that make Glen Echo Park special (in order as they appear on the National Register Nomination Form).   Chautauqua Tower (page under construction)   1921 Dentzel Carousel (page under construction)   Bumper Car Pavilion (page under construction)   Crystal Pool (page under construction)   Spanish Ballroom (page under construction)   Administration (Arcade) Building (page under construction)   Cuddle Up Pavilion (page under construction)   Yellow Barn (page under construction)   Picnic Grove (page under construction)
